sen.j: 元子女王（げんし（もとこ）じょおう、生没年不詳）は、平安時代前期の皇族。
sen.e: Princess Genshi (Motoko) (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the imperial family in the first half of the Heian period.
Princess Genshi (Motoko) (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the imperial family during the first half of the Heian period.
Princess Genshi (also known a Motoko) (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family during the first half of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: also known a 補足用語統一

sen.e: Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 仁明天皇の皇孫で、本康親王の娘。
sen.e: She was an imperial descendant of Emperor Ninmyo, and was a daughter of Imperial Prince Motoyasu.
She was an imperial descendant of Emperor Ninmyo, and was a daughter of Imperial Prince Motoyasu.
She was an imperial descendant of Emperor Ninmyo, and was a daughter of Imperial Prince Motoyasu.

sen.j: 兄弟に源兼似らがいた。
sen.e: 源兼似 is one of her siblings.
sen.cmt: 源兼似→読み方不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: 源兼似 was one of her siblings.
源兼似 was one of her siblings.

sen.j: 繁子内親王（光孝天皇皇女）の退下を受けて、寛平元年（889年）2月に従兄弟宇多天皇の斎宮に卜定された。
sen.e: Ａｆｔｅｒ Imperial Princess Hanshi (princess of Emperor Koko) resigned, she was designated as Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her cousin, Emperor Uda by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) in February 889.

Ａｆｔｅｒ Imperial Princess Hanshi (princess of Emperor Koko) resigned, she was designated as Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her cousin, Emperor Uda by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling) in February 889.

Ａｆｔｅｒ Imperial Princess Hanshi (princess of Emperor Koko) resigned, she was designated as Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of her cousin, Emperor Uda by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling) in March 889.
In September 889, she went through misogi (purification ceremony).
In September 889, she went through misogi (purification ceremony).
In October 889, she went through misogi (purification ceremony).
In September 890, she entered into Nonomiya (Field Palace).
In September 890, she entered Nonomiya (Field Palace).
In September 890, she entered Nonomiya (Field Palace).

sen.j: 寛平3年（991年）9月伊勢に下向し、寛平9年退下した。
sen.e: In September 991, she went down to Ise, and resigned the post in Ise in 997.
In September 991, she went down to Ise, and resigned her post in Ise in 997.
In October 991, she went down to Ise, and resigned her post in Ise in 997.

sen.j: その後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: Nothing was heard of her after that.
Nothing was heard of her after that.
Nothing was heard of her after that.
